file_content.text: Jedi, the Council sees you've arrived on Tatooine. Good. We can't waste any time.
Tatooine is a vast desert world, where survival is often precarious.
Master Eriz Vossan, one of the Jedi's best cultural explorers, was there when he dropped out of contact with the Council.
What exactly does a cultural explorer do?
Cultural explorer?
The Jedi Council relies on people like Master Eriz to develop relationships with the varied cultures of the galaxy.
He can understand and adapt to even the most strange and violent societies.
Has he exhibited any symptoms of the plague?
You think he's ill?
No--but he was a member of the expedition to Malachor Three, as were Master Yuon and the others.
What's he going to do--turn the sand to the dark side?
I don't see the problem.
Cultures must perform a delicate balancing act to even survive on Tatooine. Master Eriz came to Tatooine to study that balancing act.
If this illness has claimed him, it would be a great loss to the Jedi Order, and threaten the groups he was sent to study.
Any idea where I should begin my search?
Where do I start?
Not on my watch.
Then I guess I'd better get to work.
Okay... if you insist.
Eriz hired a guide to help him navigate Tatooine's treacherous deep desert and make contact with its residents.
One of Master Eriz's last reports was that his guide had developed the Sand Rot, an illness caused by prolonged, repeated desert exposure.
The guide's name is Rowan Delk, and he is currently recuperating at the Dreviad Outpost medical center. He's your best lead.
What if Rowan Delk can't help me?
And if he doesn't know?
This is your investigation, to handle as you see fit.
Rowan Delk. Understood.
I don't want to catch Sand Rot.
He's not contagious, is he?
It's not a germ. You'll be fine unless you spend too long in the deep desert.
Work quickly; Master Eriz is vital to the order. And if he has this plague... well, you, more than any of us, know what that means.
